alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Greene; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:36PM EDT until March 31 at 12:12PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers and creek in Indiana... Sugar Creek near Edinburgh. White River at multiple locations. Mississinewa River near Ridgeville. Youngs Creek at Amity. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Petersburg and Hazleton. Eel River at Bowling Green. .Excessive rainfall continues to drive area waterways higher, and this is pushing Sugar Creek at Edinburgh into flood. The water level is expected to continue rising overnight. At present it is forecast to crest slightly over 1 foot above flood stage, but later forecasts likely will differ from this initial prediction. Please stay abreast of the latest conditions by monitoring further information from the National Weather Service and local media. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Newberry. * WHEN...From this evening to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Extensive agricultural flooding is in progress. Some state and county roads flood. County Road 600 W just north of river flooded by possibly more than two feet of water for a considerable distance in Mary Long Cutoff Area. County Roads 900 W and 750 S begin to flood in Greene County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EDT Friday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.2 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
